claims.description: Multi-agent systems leak more than single-agent
claims.note: Ratio may vary based on scenario mix

claims.description: Internal channels (C2, C5) have higher leak rates than external (C1)
claims.note: C2 and C5 should both exceed C1
H1 = C2 or C5 leaked, but C1 safe

claims.description: Inter-agent channel (C2) leaks more than output (C1)
claims.note: Core claim: internal channels are undefended

claims.description: C2 > C1 holds across all models
claims.paper_value: Consistent across GPT-4o, Claude, Llama, Mistral
claims.measured_value: claude-3.5-sonnet: C2=28.1% vs C1=3.3%; llama-3.3-70b-instruct: C2=67.8% vs C1=26.9%; mistral-large-2512: C2=96.2% vs C1=47.5%; gpt-4o: C2=76.8% vs C1=17.2%

claims.description: C2 > C1 holds across all domains
claims.paper_value: Healthcare, Finance, Legal, Corporate all show pattern
claims.note: Pattern is consistent across regulated industries
